Community Sightings

Collected Accounts from the Upper Branches

The following entries are submitted by hikers, foresters, and attentive wanderers. All reports are archived as part of our ongoing Community Canopy Log.

July 14 - Collegiate Peaks Wilderness

Submitted by: M. Alvarez, trail crew volunteer

"No visual confirmation, but something moved along the branch line above the creek - too deliberate for a squirrel, too damp for a bird. A single drop hit my notebook. I waited. Nothing else happened. It felt…complete."

Confidence Level: ★★★☆☆

September 2 - Near Monarch Pass

Submitted by: 'AspenDad42'

"My kid asked why the tree was dripping when it hadn't rained. I told him about tree trout. He nodded like that answered everything. Later he said he thought one blinked at him."

Confidence Level: ★★★★☆

June 28 - Unnamed Tributary, Northern Rockies

Submitted by: L. Chen, amateur entomologist

"Noticeable absence of aphids on lower branches near the stream. Bark showed faint smearing consistent with lateral movement. I did not see a fish. I did see evidence of fish-like ambition."

Confidence Level: ★★★★★

October 6 - Trailhead Parking Area

Submitted by: Anonymous

"I didn't believe in this until I heard something flop, then immediately stop flopping, like it realized it was being rude."

Confidence Level: ★★★☆☆

Submission Notes

We welcome sightings of all certainty levels, including:

  • "Pretty sure"
  • "Maybe?"
  • "My grandmother insists"
  • "I didn't see it but now I think about it a lot"
